intro: Cicer arietinum var. vulgare, commonly known as chickpea, is an annual legume native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and distinctive pod-like structures that contain clusters of angular seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is a valuable crop for both human consumption and animal feed due to its high protein content. The seeds are rich in nutrients and are widely used in various cuisines around the world.
